variant.question: A person attempting to enter the territory of a State has been confirmed as inadmissible. How much time does the Operator have to ensure the removal of this person?

options.text: The State determines the time frame for the removal, which is binding on the aircraft Operator.
The aircraft Operator determines how much time the removal requires and informs the State.
The State consults the aircraft Operator and allows the Operator a reasonable amount of time.
The time frame for the removal is specified in ICAO Annex 9 (Facilitation).

variant.question: Facilitation Inadmissible passengers – When a person is found inadmissible, and is returned to the aircraft operator for transport away from the territory of the State, the aircraft operator shall remove the inadmissible person to..

options.text: the State of the aircraft operator, or to any place where the person is admissible.
the point where he/she commenced his/her journey, or the person\`s State of origin.
the State of the aircraft operator, or the person\`s State of origin.
the point where he/she commenced his/her journey, or to any place where he/she is admissible.

variant.question:
On departure, how many copies are required of the following documents:

1. General Declaration
2. Stores List
3. Cargo Manifest

options.text: 1 of 1; 1 of 2; 2 of 3
2 of 1; 2 of 2; 3 of 3
3 of each
2 of 1; 1 of 2; 2 of 3

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 9 and in the case of customs clearance, when a passenger's baggage is delayed or mishandled, his/her unaccompanied baggage will...

options.text: NOT be loaded in the cargo hold and returned to the owner because baggage must travel with his/her owner.
NOT be cleared and will be subject to the taxes of the Contracting State.
be cleared under simplified arrangements.
be cleared if it weighs less than 12 kg.

variant.question: When an unruly passenger endangers the safety of the aircraft, the aircraft commander..

options.text: may disembark the unruly passenger in the territory of any State.
must overfly the State of Registry of the aircraft to exercise his/her authority.
must disembark the unruly passenger in the State over which the unruly behaviour took place.
may only ask for assistance from cabin crew in restraining the unruly passenger.

variant.question: A passenger is found inadmissible. How long shall the removing state allow the operating carrier to effect that passenger's removel via its own services?

options.text: 36 hours.
12 hours.
24 hours.
48 hours.

variant.question: When a passenger and his/her luggage arrive at an aerodrome, in ICAO Annex 9 provisions request the State to…

options.text: Give passengers with first class tickets priority over other passengers for their inspections as well as their luggage.
Perform at least a double border control. For security reasons, the delays caused by these measures have NO limitation.
Adopt border control regulations appropriate to the air transport environment and prevent unnecessary delays.
Prevent any delays for passengers due to the increase of the border and luggage controls.

variant.question: Unaccompanied baggage to be carried by air shall be cleared under the procedures applicable for..

options.text: cargo when covered by a traffic document.
accompanied baggage, or under another simplified customs procedure distinct from that normally applied to cargo.
cargo but shall be not subject to any kind of declaration forms.
cargo but the requested customs clearance documents provided by airlines shall be completed by the passenger prior to shipment.

variant.question: A passenger is found inadmissible. How long does the operator have to deport the PAX?

options.text: 36 hours
24 hours
48 hours
12 hours
